attributes.action: Reparations for decedents of the enslaved and those impacted by colonisation.
attributes.additional_details: The UK enslaved hundreds of thousands of people in the Caribbean. Britain was the most dominant between 1640 and 1807. The UK compensated slave traders and Onwership when slavery was abolished but never compensated the descendants of the enslaved - who actually needed and deserved the money! The UK has commuted horrendous crimes and colonised countries and continents. We want those impacted by the UKs vicious racist regime to Aldo be compensated.
attributes.background: We demand a discussion to be had on reparations for the descendants of those enslaved by the UK in the Caribbean. We also demand a discussion to be had on reparations being paid to those impacted by the UKs racist history, colonisation and imperialism.

rejection.details:
Pay Slavery Reparations to all Caribbean & African Descendants: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325237
 
Legislate for the provision of reparations to communities affected by slavery: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325529
 
Refund taxes used to pay slavery abolition debt to British descendants of slaves: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325536
 
Reimburse tax payers for monies used to compensate slave owners: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325300

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
